version.name: v1.3.2
version.model_difference: Added support for additional diagnostic categories and retrained with improved annotated data.
Refined classification layers and improved class balance in training.

identity_and_basic_information.overview: MediScan-Classifier is a deep learning model for detecting and classifying abnormalities in chest X-ray images, including pneumonia, tuberculosis, and nodules.
identity_and_basic_information.citation: Smith, A. et al. (2025). MediScan-Classifier: Automated Chest X-Ray Diagnosis. Journal of Medical AI.

source_and_distribution.model_origin: Developed in collaboration with academic radiology departments and medical AI research teams.

ontology_and_semantic_maping.external_factors: Guidance from clinical taxonomy used in diagnosis reports

model_architecture.input_format: Grayscale chest X-ray, 1024x1024 resolution, DICOM converted to PNG
model_architecture.output_format: Multilabel classification vector with probability scores for 14 conditions

training_information.training_methodology: Supervised learning with label smoothing, dropout, class reweighting, and medical expert review of labels.
training_information.training_data_overview: 150,000 chest X-ray images from NIH and Stanford, including multi-label annotations for thoracic diseases.

metrics.description: Area Under the Curve for disease classification on CheXpert validation set
metrics.slice: Male vs Female; Age > 60 vs Age <= 60
metrics.assumptions: Evaluation set is representative of hospital imaging diversity; assumes frontal X-rays only

evaluation_and_performance.evaluation_objective: Assess diagnostic accuracy and consistency with radiologist-level interpretations
evaluation_and_performance.benchmark_standard: CheXpert competition leaderboard; NIH benchmark scores

deployment_and_operations.infrastructure_requirements: Linux VM, NVIDIA GPU (A100 or RTX 3090), 8GB VRAM, DICOM-compatible image handling
deployment_and_operations.deployment_constraints: Model does not support lateral chest X-rays; requires normalization to specific pixel spacing
deployment_and_operations.visibility: Restricted access for clinical trial partners and approved healthcare institutions

known_limitations: Does not detect cardiomegaly reliably in supine X-rays
performance_tradeoffs: Sensitivity prioritized over specificity to minimize missed conditions
Longer inference time due to multiple augmentations for ensemble averaging

security_and_risk_assessment.robustness: Withstands variations in contrast and brightness; fails on non-standard aspect ratios
security_and_risk_assessment.confusers: Often confuses pleural effusion with pulmonary edema in lower quality scans
security_and_risk_assessment.adversarial_robustness: Not tested against adversarial inputs due to clinical safety constraints
security_and_risk_assessment.explainability: Grad-CAM visual heatmaps integrated into the UI for clinical review

risk_type: Misdiagnosis due to poor image quality
risk.mitigation_strategy: Pre-screening DICOM metadata and applying quality assurance filters
Ongoing audit and reweighting of training data demographics

custom_metadata.sponsoring_organization: National Institute of Health AI Research
custom_metadata.additional_notes: Not intended to replace licensed radiologist. Clinical validation ongoing.
custom_metadata.customer_performance_thresholds: Minimum AUC 0.90 on CheXpert validation for regulatory clearance
custom_metadata.users: Radiologists, Clinical AI Analysts, Hospital IT Integrators
custom_metadata.use_cases: Triage assistance in emergency departments, second-opinion analysis in rural clinics
